tool_description: Fancy Twitter provides an interface to Twitter that only includes tweets from the actual athletes and their team and league offices. You can also sort these tweets by AI/ML-generated Sentiment and Subjectivity scores.
title: Fancy Twitter

api_list.name: organizations_all
api_list.description: Return information about all of the organizations/leagues that Fancy Twitter tracks.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/db/organizations/all"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

twitterplayerlistnumber.description: Twitter list number for players in the league

twitterteamlistnumber.description: Twitter list number for teams in the league

twitteruserid.description: Twitter user id for the league office

twitterusername.description: Twitter user name for the league office

api_list.name: leagues_all
api_list.description: Return information about all of the organizations/leagues that Fancy Twitter tracks.

twitterplayerlistnumber.description: Twitter list number for players in the league

twitterteamlistnumber.description: Twitter list number for teams in the league

twitteruserid.description: Twitter user id for the league office

api_list.name: team_tweets_negative_sentiment_average
api_list.description: Returns a list of teams whose players' tweets express the least positive sentiments.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/db/tweets/negativesentiment/team/average"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

averagesentiment.description: ML-generated estimate of the average sentiment of all tweets.  Ranges between -1.0 (negative) and 1.0 (positive)

averagesubjectivity.description: ML-generated estimate of the average subjectivity of all tweets.  Ranges between 0.0 (objective) and 1.0 (subjective)

api_list.name: leagues_filter
api_list.description: Filter the organization list to get information about a single organization/league

twitterplayerlistnumber.description: Twitter list number for players in the league

twitterteamlistnumber.description: Twitter list number for teams in the league

twitteruserid.description: Twitter user id for the league office

twitterusername.description: Twitter user name for the league office

averagesentiment.description: ML-generated estimate of the average sentiment of all tweets.  Ranges between -1.0 (negative) and 1.0 (positive)

api_list.name: leagues_tweets_all
api_list.description: Return all tweets from a given organization/league office (Limit 100)

likes.description: Number of Likes of this Tweet.

retweets.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

replies.description: Number of Replies of this Tweet.

quotes.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted with a comment (also known as Quote).

url.description: URL of the official league site

api_list.name: team_tweets_sentiment_average
api_list.description: Returns a list of teams whose players' tweets express the most positive sentiments.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/db/tweets/sentiment/team/average"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

averagesentiment.description: ML-generated estimate of the average sentiment of all tweets.  Ranges between -1.0 (negative) and 1.0 (positive)

averagesubjectivity.description: ML-generated estimate of the average subjectivity of all tweets.  Ranges between 0.0 (objective) and 1.0 (subjective)

api_list.name: team_tweets_subjectivity_average
api_list.description: Returns a list of teams whose players' tweets are deemed by the ML algorithm as the most subjective.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/db/tweets/subjectivity/team/average"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

averagesentiment.description: ML-generated estimate of the average sentiment of all tweets.  Ranges between -1.0 (negative) and 1.0 (positive)

averagesubjectivity.description: ML-generated estimate of the average subjectivity of all tweets.  Ranges between 0.0 (objective) and 1.0 (subjective)

api_list.name: team_tweets_all
api_list.description: Get team information, filtered by a single team/league/organization

id.description: Unique id of ths tweet.  Can be used to construct a URL to the tweet.

like_count.description: Number of Likes of this Tweet.

quote_count.description: Number of Likes of this Tweet.

reply_count.description: Number of Replies of this Tweet.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

sentiment_score.description: ML-generated score based on the tweet_text

subjectivity_score.description: ML-generated score based on the tweet_text

tweet_text.description: The content of the individual Tweet.

twitterusername.description: Twitter handle. May or may not include the @ prefix

api_list.name: team_tweets_objectivity_average
api_list.description: Returns a list of teams whose players' tweets are deemed by the ML algorithm as the most objective.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/db/tweets/objectivity/team/average"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

averagesentiment.description: ML-generated estimate of the average sentiment of all tweets.  Ranges between -1.0 (negative) and 1.0 (positive)

averagesubjectivity.description: ML-generated estimate of the average subjectivity of all tweets.  Ranges between 0.0 (objective) and 1.0 (subjective)

api_list.name: orgs_tweets_all
api_list.description: Return all tweets from a given organization/league office (Limit 100)

likes.description: Number of Likes of this Tweet.

retweets.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

replies.description: Number of Replies of this Tweet.

quotes.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted with a comment (also known as Quote).

url.description: URL of the official league site

api_list.name: tweets_filter
api_list.description: Returns filtered tweet information.  Limited to 100 tweets.  Note that this does not return league front office or team tweets.  (Just player-originated tweets)

required_parameters.name: handle
required_parameters.description: Player's twitter handle.  Returns tweets from the player with the given twitter handle.  Note that players without Twitter accounts are often associated with their League's twitter handle.

required_parameters.name: team
required_parameters.description: Team name (including city).  Returns tweets from players from the requested team.

required_parameters.name: order_by
required_parameters.description: Sort order of the returned tweet list. Allowed values include [handle|lastupdate|like_count|quote_count|reply_count|retweet_count|sentiment_classification|sentiment_score|subjectivity_classification|subjectivity_score|team|text|tweeter_name|tweetid]

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Twitter-assigned unique id.  Returns one (or 0) tweets.  Note that Fancy Twitter does not save old tweets, so query twitter directly for older tweets.

handle.description: Twitter handle. May or may not include the @ prefix

like_count.description: Number of Likes of this Tweet.

quote_count.description: Number of Likes of this Tweet.

reply_count.description: Number of Replies of this Tweet.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

sentiment_score.description: ML-generated score based on the tweet_text

subjectivity_score.description: ML-generated score based on the tweet_text

tweet_text.description: The content of the individual Tweet.

twitterusername.description: Twitter handle. May or may not include the @ prefix

tweetid.description: Unique id of ths tweet.  Can be used to construct a URL to the tweet.

api_list.name: tweets_all
api_list.description: Returns individual tweets, associated statistics and ML-based sentiment analysis data.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/db/tweets/all"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: players_all

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fancy-twitter2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/db/players/all"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

api_list.name: player_filter
api_list.description: Returns filtered player information.  Limited to 100 players

required_parameters.name: team
required_parameters.description: Team name (including city).  Returns all of the players that play for the requested team

required_parameters.name: name
required_parameters.description: Player's full name.  Note that there are a few duplicate names in the various leagues

required_parameters.name: handle
required_parameters.description: Player's twitter handle.  Returns information about the player with the given twitter handle.  Note that players without Twitter accounts are often associated with their League's twitter handle.

averagesentiment.description: ML-generated estimate of the average sentiment of all tweets.  Ranges between -1.0 (negative) and 1.0 (positive)

averagesubjectivity.description: ML-generated estimate of the average subjectivity of all tweets.  Ranges between 0.0 (objective) and 1.0 (subjective)

api_list.name: team_tweets_subjectivity

averagesentiment.description: ML-generated estimate of the average sentiment of all tweets.  Ranges between -1.0 (negative) and 1.0 (positive)

averagesubjectivity.description: ML-generated estimate of the average subjectivity of all tweets.  Ranges between 0.0 (objective) and 1.0 (subjective)
